rhinoplasty.context: The patient healed status post rhinoplasty as a result but was left with a persistent saddle-nose dorsal defect.

Revision rhinoplasty.context: Procedure: Revision rhinoplasty (CPT 30450). Left conchal cartilage harvest (CPT 21235).

Left conchal cartilage harvest.context: Procedure: Revision rhinoplasty (CPT 30450). Left conchal cartilage harvest (CPT 21235).

nasal fracture.context: This patient is an otherwise healthy male who had a previous nasal fracture.

hockey puck to the nose.context: During his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.

saddle-nose deformity.context: During his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.

septal hematoma.context: During his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.

saddle-nose dorsal defect.context: The patient healed status post rhinoplasty as a result but was left with a persistent saddle-nose dorsal defect.

Lidocaine with epinephrine.context: Approximately 3 mL of 1% Lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was infiltrated into the subcutaneous tissues of the conchal bulb.

cocaine pledgets.context: In addition to this, cocaine pledgets were placed to assist with hemostasis.

broad lower lateral cartilages.context: The patient did have very broad lower lateral cartilages leading to a bulbous tip.

bulbous tip.context: The patient did have very broad lower lateral cartilages leading to a bulbous tip.

medial and lateral osteotomies.context: The lower lateral cartilages were trimmed in a symmetrical fashion leaving at least 8 mm of lower lateral cartilage bilaterally along the lateral aspect. Having completed this, the patient had medial and lateral osteotomies performed with a 2-mm osteotome.

Gore-Tex implant.context: Next, attention was turned to dorsal augmentation. A Gore-Tex small implant had been selected, previously incised. This was taken to the back table and carved under sterile conditions. The patient then had the implant placed into the super-tip area to assist with support of the nasal dorsum.

columella strut.context: Next, attention was turned to performing a columella strut. The cartilage from the concha was shaped into a strut and placed into a precision pocket between the medial footplate of the lower lateral cartilage.

hematoma.context: There was no evidence of hematoma, and the patient had a series of brown Steri-Strips and Aquaplast cast placed over the nasal dorsum.

antibiotics.context: He was charged to home on antibiotics to prevent infection both from the left ear conchal cartilage harvest and also the Gore-Tex implant area.

infection.context: He was charged to home on antibiotics to prevent infection both from the left ear conchal cartilage harvest and also the Gore-Tex implant area.
